intro: Chaetocrater reflexus, commonly known as the reflexed chaetocrater, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, hairy stems and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its flowers, which are usually pink or purple, bloom in summer and attract various pollinators. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it is relatively rare in the wild.
